channel.title: Comments on: Sun Should Be in the Consumer Cloud Services Business

item.title: By: Amazon RDS for Aurora – Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Amazon RDS for Aurora – Joseph Scott
item.description: […] at all this I’m reminded of something I wrote back in April 2008: Sun Should Be in the Consumer Cloud Services Business ( this was a few months after Sun purchased MySQL and before Oracle purchased Sun […]
item.content:encoded: […] at all this I’m reminded of something I wrote back in April 2008: Sun Should Be in the Consumer Cloud Services Business ( this was a few months after Sun purchased MySQL and before Oracle purchased Sun […]

item.title: By: Jean-Baptiste
item.dc:creator: Jean-Baptiste
item.description: During a conversation with Jonathan, he confirmed that Sun will be moving towards Cloud Services. Not sure if it'll be consumer oriented. But Sun does intend to compete with Amazon. So does EMC, according to its CEO that I've interviewed during RSA. Here's the link to the Schwartz interview on my blog: http://www.uberpulse.com/us/2008/04/mysql_conference_sun_plans_to_build_own_cloud_compete_with_amazon_web_services_podcast.php
item.content:encoded:
During a conversation with Jonathan, he confirmed that Sun will be moving towards Cloud Services. Not sure if it’ll be consumer oriented. But Sun does intend to compete with Amazon. So does EMC, according to its CEO that I’ve interviewed during RSA.
Here’s the link to the Schwartz interview on my blog: http://www.uberpulse.com/us/2008/04/mysql_conference_sun_plans_to_build_own_cloud_compete_with_amazon_web_services_podcast.php

item.title: By: Payment Systems As A Strategic Advantage - Joseph Scott’s Blog
item.dc:creator: Payment Systems As A Strategic Advantage - Joseph Scott’s Blog
item.description: [...] couple of days after suggesting that Sun should offer cloud services they announced that they would be supporting Amazon EC2 by having it run Sun’s OpenSolaris [...]
